**The Orb of Detection** is the [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"). It is the prize for completing the [Archeologist quest](/wiki/Archeologist_quest "Archeologist quest"), and is [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") for [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") purposes. Its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") type is a [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Variants](#Variants)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Effects

While carried, the Orb of Detection confers [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") and [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage"); [invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") the Orb toggles [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility") on or off. The Orb of Detection can also be [applied](/wiki/Applied "Applied") like any crystal ball for the same effects.

## Strategy

- *See also: [Invoke § Optimum invocation schedule](/wiki/Invoke#Optimum_invocation_schedule "Invoke")*

Archaeologists' high [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence") let them make good use of the Orb of Detection for [portal detection](/wiki/Portal_detection_methods "Portal detection methods"). The invoke effect is not useful, since sources of invisibility are common.

If you are carrying it for its magic resistance, it is recommended to find a source of worn magic resistance before challenging the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), since he can steal it.

As a lawful artifact wish, the Orb of Detection has a more useful base type than the [Magic Mirror of Merlin](/wiki/Magic_Mirror_of_Merlin "Magic Mirror of Merlin") and provides half spell damage. However, it is much heavier.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

For crystal balls in general: You can now search for [dungeon features](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature") by entering any of [<](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") [>](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") [\_](/wiki/Altar "Altar") [\\](/wiki/Throne "Throne") [#](/wiki/Sink "Sink") [{](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"). Doing so will find all of these features regardless of which one you entered.

The intelligence check when applying a crystal ball now uses a d8 instead of d20 if it is your own [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), or d16 for other blessed crystal balls.

Crystal balls are now generated with 3-7 charges. Uncursed charging adds 1-2 charges up to the maximum of 7. Blessed charging increases the number of charges to 7 and also blesses the ball. Cursed charging removes all charges and curses the ball.

Applying a [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") crystal ball now destroys it, regardless of whether or not it is an artifact.

## Variants

Many variants implement [L](/wiki/L_\(person\) "L (person)")'s Itlachiayaque Patch, which has the Orb of Detection replaced by [Itlachiayaque](/wiki/Itlachiayaque "Itlachiayaque"), a lawful-aligned [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") with some similar properties. xNetHack implements this patch, but additionally allows Itlachiayaque to be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") and used like a crystal ball; [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") instead replaces the Orb with [Xiuhcoatl](/index.php?title=Xiuhcoatl\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Xiuhcoatl (page does not exist)"), a lawful [atlatl](/index.php?title=Atlatl\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Atlatl (page does not exist)").

## Encyclopedia entry

This Orb is a crystal ball of exceptional powers. When carried, it grants ESP, limits damage done by spells, and protects the carrier from magic missiles. When invoked it allows the carrier to become invisible.

The Orb of Detection is the Archeologist quest artifact. It is the prize for completing the Archeologist quest, and is lawful for wishing purposes. Its base item type is a crystal ball.

Effects

While carried, the Orb of Detection confers magic resistance, telepathy and half spell damage; invoking the Orb toggles invisibility on or off. The Orb of Detection can also be applied like any crystal ball for the same effects.

Strategy

See also: Invoke § Optimum invocation schedule

Archaeologists' high intelligence let them make good use of the Orb of Detection for portal detection. The invoke effect is not useful, since sources of invisibility are common.

If you are carrying it for its magic resistance, it is recommended to find a source of worn magic resistance before challenging the Wizard of Yendor, since he can steal it.

As a lawful artifact wish, the Orb of Detection has a more useful base type than the Magic Mirror of Merlin and provides half spell damage. However, it is much heavier.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

For crystal balls in general: You can now search for dungeon features by entering any of < > _ \ # {. Doing so will find all of these features regardless of which one you entered.

The intelligence check when applying a crystal ball now uses a d8 instead of d20 if it is your own quest artifact, or d16 for other blessed crystal balls.

Crystal balls are now generated with 3-7 charges. Uncursed charging adds 1-2 charges up to the maximum of 7. Blessed charging increases the number of charges to 7 and also blesses the ball. Cursed charging removes all charges and curses the ball.

Applying a cancelled crystal ball now destroys it, regardless of whether or not it is an artifact.

Variants

Many variants implement L's Itlachiayaque Patch, which has the Orb of Detection replaced by Itlachiayaque, a lawful-aligned shield of reflection with some similar properties. xNetHack implements this patch, but additionally allows Itlachiayaque to be invoked and used like a crystal ball; EvilHack instead replaces the Orb with Xiuhcoatl, a lawful atlatl.
